zone.line: Bright wanderer, fair coquette of Heaven,
To whom alone it has been given
To change and be adored for ever,
Envy not this dim world, for never
But once within its shadow grew
One fair as you but far more true
She left me at the silent time
When the moon had ceased to climb
The azure dome path of Heaven’s deep steep
And like an albatross asleep
Heaven Balanced on her wings of light.
Hovered in the purple night —

mod.del: And I who sat beside her feet

zone.line: Ere she flew to seek her sought her ocean nest,
In the chambers of the west. —
She left me, and I hath staid alone
Thinking over every tone,
Which though now silent to the ear
The enchanted heart could hear
Like music pleasant fast to reach us
Like notes which die when born, but still
Haunt the echoes of the hill:
And the feeling ever— o too much
The soft vibrations of her touch
As if her gentle hand even now
Lightly placed trembles on my brow
